channel.title: Compiler Help (Not what you think, My compiler works)
channel.description:
I didn't know where else to put this, because ther eisn't a section and I don't use 'Moparisthebest'. So I've got a Windows 7 Ultimate computer 64-BIT. When I have my compiler and when I'm trying to make stuff in eclipse I have to use the directory of where my Java.exe program is. i can't just use the Java tag like a 32-BIT.
Example:
64-BIT: [code=java]@echo off title Compiler "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_22\bin\javac.exe" -classpath deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/jython.jar;deps/xstream.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/poi.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar -d bin src\server\event\*.java src\server\model\items\*.java src\server\model\minigames\*.java src\server\model\npcs\*.java src\server\model\objects\*.java src\server\model\players\*.java src\server\model\players\skills\*.java src\server\model\players\packets\*.java src\server\model\shops\*.java src\server\net\*.java src\server\task\*.java src\server\util\*.java src\server\world\*.java src\server\util\log\*.java src\server\*.java src\server\world\map\*.java pause [/code]
32-BIT: java [code=java]javac -classpath deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/jython.jar;deps/xstream.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/poi.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar -d bin src\server\event\*.java src\server\model\items\*.java src\server\model\minigames\*.java src\server\model\npcs\*.java src\server\model\objects\*.java src\server\model\players\*.java src\server\model\players\skills\*.java src\server\model\players\packets\*.java src\server\model\shops\*.java src\server\net\*.java src\server\task\*.java src\server\util\*.java src\server\world\*.java src\server\util\log\*.java src\server\*.java src\server\world\map\*.java [/code]
I'd like to be able to use the [b]Javac[/b] keyword instead of the directory any help.
Thanks,
Runescape-Xperia. ;)

item.title: Compiler Help (Not what you think, My compiler works)
item.dc:creator: @Runescape-Xperia Runescape-Xperia
item.description:
@Runescape-Xperia wrote:

Mendorphins:

Surely you set the environment variables? You must of already done this though, right? If so, check the version in your CLASSPATH and Path are 6.0_22.

Wow, can’t believe it. I restored my computer and forgot to reset he PATH’s and CLASSPATH’s. Everythings fixed now.

Read full topic
item.source: Compiler Help (Not what you think, My compiler works)

item.title: Compiler Help (Not what you think, My compiler works)
item.dc:creator: @Runescape-Xperia Runescape-Xperia
item.description:
@Runescape-Xperia wrote:

I didn’t know where else to put this, because ther eisn’t a section and I don’t use ‘Moparisthebest’. So I’ve got a Windows 7 Ultimate computer 64-BIT. When I have my compiler and when I’m trying to make stuff in eclipse I have to use the directory of where my Java.exe program is. i can’t just use the Java tag like a 32-BIT.

Example:

64-BIT:

@echo off title Compiler "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_22\bin\javac.exe" -classpath deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/jython.jar;deps/xstream.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/poi.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar -d bin src\server\event\*.java src\server\model\items\*.java src\server\model\minigames\*.java src\server\model\npcs\*.java src\server\model\objects\*.java src\server\model\players\*.java src\server\model\players\skills\*.java src\server\model\players\packets\*.java src\server\model\shops\*.java src\server\net\*.java src\server\task\*.java src\server\util\*.java src\server\world\*.java src\server\util\log\*.java src\server\*.java src\server\world\map\*.java pause

32-BIT: java

javac -classpath deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/jython.jar;deps/xstream.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/poi.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar -d bin src\server\event\*.java src\server\model\items\*.java src\server\model\minigames\*.java src\server\model\npcs\*.java src\server\model\objects\*.java src\server\model\players\*.java src\server\model\players\skills\*.java src\server\model\players\packets\*.java src\server\model\shops\*.java src\server\net\*.java src\server\task\*.java src\server\util\*.java src\server\world\*.java src\server\util\log\*.java src\server\*.java src\server\world\map\*.java

I’d like to be able to use the Javac keyword instead of the directory any help.

Thanks,

Runescape-Xperia.

Read full topic
